item.title: Report E-2023090096
item.description:
Report E-2023090096

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ACTION RESOURCES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Truck transporting tank trailer load of Nitric Acid was in transit when the driver noticed product leaking from the front portion of the tank onto the rear portion of the truck. Driver pulled over to the shoulder of the road to investigate. Driver discovered a small leak coming from the tank. 911 was called for assistance. The fire department responded and deployed the hazmat team. The roadway was shut down as a precaution. Enviromental response and remediation crew was dispatched to the scene to perform the cleanup, remediation and load transfer onto another tanker. The load was successfully transferred to another tanker and transported to the destination. The cleanup and remediation of the small spill have been completed. The driver accidentally inhaled some nitric fumes before donning his PPE while investigating the problem. He was transported to hospital for treatment. Driver was treated and released. Upon a full inspection of the tank, it was determined that there were some pits in the barrel that caused the leak.

item.title: Report E-2023090081
item.description:
Report E-2023090081

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of sodium hydroxide were damaged and released approximately less than one gallon (<1) of product to the dock floor and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew secured the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. HCE utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect the released material from the dock floor and adjacent freight. All clean up material was contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023090080
item.description:
Report E-2023090080

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: EAST NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, four (4) 90-pound boxes of UN2491 were torn and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools and a neutralizing agent to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and the damaged containers of product were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023090079
item.description:
Report E-2023090079

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of NA1760 was crushed during a load shift and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the released material and worked them in using hand tools. The crew overpacked the one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum. All NA1760-impacted material was containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for terminal disposal.

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, three (3) 5-gallon pails of UN2014 combusted during transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted surfaces. PES personnel observed the hydrogen peroxide has evaporated. PES personnel over packed the three (3) 5-gallon pails into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All UN2014-impacted waste was staged onsite for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023090004
item.description:
Report E-2023090004

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NKX experienced a UN3105 Norox MCP-75 Red release from a 5-gallon jerrican. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released impacting an 8 x 10 area of the trailer floor and a 10 x 10 area of the concrete lot below due to the pail being crushed as a result of stacking. Oil dri was deployed onto the impacted areas and worked into to clean and remove all free-standing liquid. The damaged empty jug, absorbents, PPE, and spill pads were then collected into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. An impacted pallet was also cut up and placed into a separate 55-gallon vented poly drum. Both drums were submerged with water per XPOs waste vendor requirements. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LMD experienced a UN1992 CORR21262WR release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released impacting a 20 x 20 area of the concrete dock floor and concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. The salvaged product was transferred into a new tote for shipment on. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023081030
item.description:
Report E-2023081030

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 28, 2023, at 0909 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Miami, Florida regarding the release of approximately (3) gallons combined of Tremco PUMA BC (UN1866 Resin Solution, 3, II), Tremco PUMA TC (UN1866 Resin Solution, 3, II), VULKEM 171 Primer (UN1133, Adhesive, 3, II) from (an unknown amount of) 6-gallon metal drums. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to the trailer floor, the underside of the truck, and a small area of the asphalt under the trailer. All waste generated was containerized in (1) roll-off by contractors which was staged onsite in preparation for proper disposal.

Report E-2023080994

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a battery acid release from a 1044-pound UN2794 Battery, filled with acid. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8-gallons of product released impacting an 8 x 8 area of the trailer floor and a 5 x 3 area of the concrete lot below due to improper loading. The impacted areas were neutralized with sodium bicarbonate and then collected with absorbents. The impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged battery was shrink wrapped with absorbent pads and secured to a pallet. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was received from the BREI SMARTPOST unload at the end of TWILIGHT shift by their equipment operator and dropped off on a pallet next to control room. Package was immediately to the HAZMAT cage. DescribePack: Loose cap, improper shipping, and no packaging on the inside were deemed to be the cause of the leak. It was also the wrong service type. EXPRESS/SMARTPOST barcodes were on the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent powder was placed on the leak on the pallet.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured two drums in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the bottom side of the drum putting a 1/2 inch long puncture in the drum. Drums were then removed and placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: WOODLAND
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLF experienced a five-gallon release of UN1760 Pursuit-XP from a 275-gallon poly tote that due to an open nozzle. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released impacting a 25 x 6 area on the trailer floor. The valve was closed and the tote was wiped down. Crew confirmed the tote was no longer releasing once secured and was shipped on. Spilfyter was utilized to neutralize the impacted and and oil dri was then deployed to collect all released product. All impacted absorbents and impacted wood were then collected and containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. All waste was left on site for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UAD experienced a UN1823 Caustic Soda Micropearls release from (18) 50-pound paper bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 24-ounces of product released impacting a 4 x 4 area of the trailer and dock floors due to multiple bag punctures. All damaged bags were removed from the two pallets and all released product, along with cleanup debris and PPE were collected into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The remaining bags were placed on pallets, re-stacked and secured for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER AIN SECTION-B, DOOR 19. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 1 MINUTE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION BY RESPONDER REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 2 POLY 1-GALLON JUG WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE BASE OF THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF CORRUGATED PARTITIONS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX.

item.title: Report X-2023080927
item.description:
Report X-2023080927

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Package came off of trailer# 454830 already damaged/leaking. Upon inspection of inner contents 4 X 1 gallon plastic bottles of wave solder flux. 1 gallon plastic bottle of wave solder flux had a loose cap allowing .10 gallons to release. The other 3 X 1 gallon plastic bottles of wave solder flux were not damaged. There were slotted partitions but no absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 gallon plastic bottle of wave solder flux had a loose cap leaking out .10 gallons of wave solder flux. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: 1. X-2023080856 SequenceEvent: The package was found with a wet cap and QA was informed that it was leaking. The package was properly placed in a red hazmat bin with the proper liner during overnight shift. I QA was also informed that one of the package handlers noted that the liquid from the hazmat caused a minor chemical burn that did not need hospitalization. The manager noted the injury and reported it accordingly. DescribePack: The package failure was due to the vent on the cap. The package was not placed in its correct orientation which caused this vent to leak. The cap itself was closed tightly. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The plastic pail was placed upright in it correct orientation. 2. X-2023080857 SequenceEvent: The package was taken out of the trailer with a wet cap. QA was informed that the package was leaking. The package was discovered by QA by 3:30 a.m. DescribePack: The package failure was due to a vented lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bucket was placed upright in its correct orientation.

DescribePack: Failure was due to one of the four gallon containers of Ethanol solutions that had a leaking cap that lose a quart of solution. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was communicated when discovered with a prepped non leak tote with a hazmat bag already lined. Package was shortly removed from unload with other Admins checking the trailer for hazard while the package was being seperated.

  • City: HUNKER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During transpiration back to the station, the bucket tipped over and rolled inside the truck, striking a bolt causing the perfect circle puncture. With some spillage in truck (Unknow cleanup). Upon arriving to work to check our VSA cart which drivers leave packages that are marked for QA service, I noticed a hazmat bucket lying on it side. Further investigating I saw a small hole at the bottom of the plastic pail. I placed a red hazmat bin on top on the bucket to prevent other packages being placed around it. Procced to acquire a yellow barrel, hazmat bags, gloves, inner stuffing and, absorb pads. Placed gloves on hands and placed absorb pads around leakage on the VSA cart, lifted plastic drum into red hazmat bin for processing, processed and placed into yellow drum with inner fillings and into hazmat cage. DescribePack: Small screw sized hold 1/2 inch from bottom of drum. inward puncture DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: drum was placed on side, using absorb pad and tape to prevent excess spillage during transportation.

item.title: Report X-2023080836
item.description:
Report X-2023080836

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING ON OUR LOADING DOCK. IT WAS IN AN UNMARKED BOX THAT HAD BEEN REPACKED BY ANOTHER STATION WHO FAILED TO ADD ANY UP ARROWS OR DIAMOND LABELS ONTO THE PACKAGE. THEY DID TAPE THE OP-900 TO THE PACKAGE. THE ADMIN PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED TOTE AND BROUGH IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. THEY ALSO FAILED TO RELABEL THE PACKAGE THEY JUST REPACKED IT INTO AN UNMARKED BOX AND TRIED TO SEND IT FORWARD. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS WAY TO BIG FOR JUST THE THREE ITEMS THAT WERE LOOSE INSIDE OF IT. NORMALLY THESE PACKAGES CONTAIN FOUR BOTTLES NOT JUST THREE. WHICH LEADS ME TO BELIEVE SINCE IT WAS REPACKED IF THE MISSING BOTTLE MAY OF BEEN DAMAGED. ONE OF THE ITEMS INSIDE THE PACKAGE DID OPEN FROM THE LID CAUSING IT TO SPILL OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED ITEM WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING. THE LAST TWO UNDAMGED ITEMS HAVE BEEN PROPERLY REPACKED SO THEY MAY BE RTS.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS, THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO HANDLE THE REPACKING PROCESS. DescribePack: THERE WERE FOUR BOTTLES INSIDE THE PACKAGE. ONE OF THOSE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP ON IT WHICH THEN CAUSED IT TO LEAK OUT ONTO THE OTHER 3 REMAINING BOTTLES AND ALSO CAUSING THE PACKAGE ITSELF TO BE WET. APPROXIMATELY 2 CUPS OF LIQUID LEAKED OUT OF THAT ONE BOTTLE. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: AFTER THE MANAGER SECURED AND VENTILATED THE PACKAGE I WAS CALLED OVER. I PROCEEDED TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM PROPERLY AND SECURELY. AFTER IT WAS DONE BEING REPACKED I AM WAITING FOR THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: SEEKONK
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 23, 2023, one (1) 15-gallon drum of UN3267 was damaged due to a faulty skid and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Boston Green Company BCG to remediate the impacted site. BCG personnel deployed neutralizing, granular absorbents to the corrosive-liquid impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. Crews also used hand tools to cut up the impacted pallet. BCG personnel proceeded to use a Hudson sprayer to wash down the trailer and pavement and deployed another layer of absorbents to ensure no product or product-rinseate remained at the site. All spent absorbents, the cut-up pallet, and miscellaneous cleanup debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums.

  • Description: On August 22, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3260 was damaged by a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and a HEPA shop vacuum to collect the free standing product from the trailer floor The crew then utilized degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All UN3260-impacted material was collected and containerized in one 91) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: On August 22, 2023, fifteen (15) one-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior, dock floor, and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and swept them in using hand tools. The crew then removed all impacted cardboard and plywood debris from the trailer. All clean up material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The fifteen (15) damaged one-gallon pails were placed in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. Borth drums were left onsite for further evaluation.

  • Description: On August 18, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1903 was punctured by a nail and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the concrete floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from 3R Incorporated (3R) to remediate the impacted site. Crews patched and collected the damaged 55-gallon drum and placed it in a 95-gallon over-pack drum for disposal. Crews utilized a pump up sprayer and absorbent pads to remove any residual product from the concrete floor. All quaternary ammonia compound impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 95-gallon drum and were added to RLC waste stream for disposal.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: KING OF PRUSSIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XPH experienced a UN2735 Chemcure 289 release from a 55-gallon steel drum due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released to a 3 x 3 area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture XPO terminal personnel containerized the damaged drum into an 85-gallon poly overpack prior to the contractors arrival. The contractors deployed absorbents and cleaned the impacted area. All cleanup debris was then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: GLEN MILLS

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWC experienced a UN1993 Resolv EC2472A release from a 330-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-tablespoon of product released to the tote body due to the tote cap not being sealed correctly. The crew re-secured the tote and preformed a slosh test to ensure no further release would occur in transit. The tote was wiped down and all impacted rags were placed into a 5-gallon metal pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-11
  • City: ROCK HILL
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 11, 2023, at 1018 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Rock Hill, South Carolina regarding the release of approximately (10) gallons of H834-RAA-30 (Resin Solution, UN1866, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The release was reportedly due to a punctured drum during load shift. Contractors were dispatched and upon arrival, they confirmed that the release was contained to wooden pallets and the trailer floor. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DF, and (3) 95-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN1760 Betco Extreme release from a 5-gallon bladder box. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately all 5-gallons of product released impacting a 5' x 6' area of the trailer floor and 10' x 5' area of the concrete lot below due to a puncture. Water was utilized to neutralize the impacted area and then collected with absorbents. All impacted absorbents were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. the damaged box was containerized into a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023081722
item.description:
Report X-2023081722

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY MARKED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS IDENTIFIED BY A SORTER ON THE SLIDE OF THE HUB SECONDARY THAT APPEARED TO BE WET AND STAINED ON THE OUTER CARTON. THE IMMIDIATE SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED AND A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES, DONNING THE PROPPER PPE. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET AND DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LEAKAGE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON AND TRANSPORDED THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FUTHER ISNPECTION, ONE OF THE INNER CONTAINERS WAS FOUND TO HAVE A LOOSE CAP 3/4 TURN, AND APPROXIMATELY 3 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD ESCAPED AND LEAKED ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL, THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLE WALL 95 POUND CAPACITY FIBERBOARD BOX.

item.title: Report X-2023081472
item.description:
Report X-2023081472

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: EASTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE IRREGS BELT FOR A LEAKER. THE RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE/RESPONSE SHEETS TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. THE RESPONDER THEN TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE AND ITS CONTENTS THE RESPONDER FOUND THAT THE SEAL ON THE METAL 5 GALLON BUCKET LID WAS THE MAIN POINT OF THE LEAK. THE RESPONDER STARTED THE PROCESSING.

Absorbent pads were immediately used to contain the spill and a black tote was brought over from Quality Assurance upon notification. DescribePack: A 4.0 Liter bottle of Sysmex ColorWright Stain (UN1230) leaked out due to a loose cap on the plastic bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: To control the spill, absorbent pads were used immediately and Quality Assurance was called to assess the spill, in which a black tote was used to prevent any more leakage on the dock.

  • Description: On August 17, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed during transit and released approximately four (4) ounces of product to the adjacent plywood. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 to remediate the site. E3 personnel collected the damaged pail, then deployed absorbent pads to collect the released product. The crew then containerized all paint impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 5-gallon bucket for disposal by R+L.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 16, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was punctured by a forklift and released its full contents to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed absorbents to the released material and worked them in using hand tools. The crew further deployed a degreasing agent and wiped the surfaces with absorbent pads. All UN3266-impacted material was containerized in two (2) 35-gallon drums for disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2023080724

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While loading an outbound trailer of totes at Veolia's 10-day facility in Port Allen, LA a forklift punctured the IBC. The forks of the lift were extending approximately 3-4 inches beyond the underneath of the IBC and while repositioning the tote the fork made contact with another tote behind it, resulting in a ~3" gash at the bottom corner of the container. The tote began leaking rapidly and spilled ~150 gallons within a 10 minute span. The material flooded the back of the box van and the surrounding concrete of the dock area. The Veolia team quickly began blocking off the storm drain located in the dock area with spill pads and oil dry, as well as blocking off the back of the trailer to slow the pace of the material leaking out the trailer. The spill was promptly cleaned up and absorbent material was containerized. The remaining material in the damaged tote was transferred into a new container.

item.title: Report E-2023080706
item.description:
Report E-2023080706

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPW experienced a UN3266 Temp Det release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released impacting a 10 x 30 area of the trailer floor and adjacent freight due to being crushed by other freight. The damaged pail was placed into a 15-gallon poly drum. Three 15-gallon poly drums of UN2984 hydrogen peroxide MicroTech Liquid Oxygen Bleach were impacted by the product and stained, each was placed into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. A baking soda solution was then utilized to neutralize all impacted surfaces. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into to collect all product and neutralizer. The impacted absorbents, impacted cardboard, and rags were collected and containerized into a supersack. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080696
item.description:
Report E-2023080696

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 18, 2023, at 0239 ET, XPO Logistics terminal LTU suffered a cargo related release of UN3149 AcidiShine to the trailer floor and asphalt lot below from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. On August 18, 2023, at 0530 ET, contractors arrived onsite. Crew confirmed one 55-gallon poly drum of UN3149 AcidiShine released due to a pallet nail puncture. Approximately 30-gallons released to a 5 x 30 area of the trailer floor and a 10 x 5 area of the asphalt lot below. The impacted surfaces and debris were neutralized with a vinegar solution and confirmed neutral with pH test strips. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The empty damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon vented poly drum. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were collected into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On American Airlines Flight 980, a passenger came to the aft galley saying'my Vape pod is really really hot to the touch and is Ieaking everywhere". We all jumped into action and as a precaution, used the fire containment bag and followed the directions of our manual and the directions listed on the actual bag itself. We shoved it in the aft galley cart and monitored it for the remainder of the flight. A Manager met the aircraft took the fire containment bag with the vape and talked to the passenger to get information.

item.title: Report I-2023080047
item.description:
Report I-2023080047

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: LONGVIEW
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PLAINS MARKETING LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Description: On July 2, 2023 at approximately 7:15 PM, a Plains transport driver with a load of crude oil was traveling southbound on State Highway 42 in Gregg County, TX. At the intersection of Hwy 42 and Texaco Rd, a 2012 Nissan traveling east on Texaco Rd failed to stop at a stop sign and collided with Plains transport, causing the tank trailer to separate from the tractor and roll over into the ditch. Upon separation, the landing gear broke off and punctured a 3x3 inch hole in the trailer, at the 7 o'clock position if upright, but upon roll over, puncture was located at the 10 o'clock position. As a result of the collision, 70 gallons of diesel from the transport fuel tank and approximately 2 gallons of hydraulic fluid, from the trailer hydraulic pump and lines, were released to the roadway and roadside ditch. The Plains vehicle and the other vehicle were non drivable and had to be towed from the scene. An absorbent was applied to the roadway to encapsulate the diesel and hydraulic fluid, then swept and contained in 55 gallon drums. The impacted roadside ditch has been excavated to remove impacted soil and manifested for disposal, in accordance with TCEQ clean-up criteria. . . The Plains employee was injured and treated at a medical facility. Occupant of other vehicle perished at the scene.

  • Description: Tanker truck was traveling westbound on 126. Per the NCSHP report, the trailer tires left the main roadway onto the rumble strip. The driver overcorrected and crashed into the shoulder guardrail. The tanker overturned and caught fire. The Polk Country Fire Dept responded and extinguished the blaze. An environmental response company was engaged and the response company began setting booms to protect waterways and clearing the roadway and shoulder. The remediation work is complete pending final sample analysis and report.

item.title: Report I-2023080022
item.description:
Report I-2023080022

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: WESTOVER
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: C THREE LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 2
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 7-11-23: At approx 2100 hrs, in Morgantown WV our truck / trailer carrying UN,2312, Phenol, Molten, 6.1, II was flagged down. A mist from the top of the tanker trailer had landed on a car following our TT; Due to the HM product, EMS was activated. Fire, Police and HM responded. There was an light odor of the product in the air. A check of a valve at the top of the tanker revealed that hit was not fully closed. The driver had performed a pre trip inspection and the valve was closed at that time. No product was exiting the tank at this time. The product, which is not under pressure, would only be able to exit that valve while ascending or descending inclines. On flat ground the product would not be able to be released. The valve was secured by HM Responders. The tanker was allowed to complete the remainder of the trip ( Approx 1/2 mile) to be unloaded. Two passerbys claimed to be affected by the product. They were transported to a local hospital for observations, then released. C Three Logistics has contracted with a HM response cleanup operation to properly decontaminate the exterior of the affected motor vehicle.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat pkg was on a closure cart in the middle area by our chutes where the closures and misloads go. I had checked on the package earlier to see where it needed to go, and did not see any leaking around the package. Someone had grabbed the cart that the package was on, and put it on the rollers attached to the chute, and about 30 minutes later, I heard the manager call out that there was a leaking Hazmat. I ran over to the area, and the manager, a PH, and another QA were picking up the leaking, corrosive Hazmat with their bare hands, putting it into a tote, and making the package leak everywhere. I immediately told them to set the package down and to clear the area. I let them know that it was a corrosive liquid and that it could burn them. They had already set it on the tugger, and it was leaking all over the back of the tugger as well. They set it down, and I grabbed it, and put it on my QA cart. When I set it on the cart, the liquid splashed up on my arms and on my left leg (as I was wearing shorts), and it started burning my skin. I told them to immediately clear the area, go rinse their hands, and I took my cart to the QA area, and hurried to the Hazmat shower to start rinsing my arms and leg off. After I had rinsed off for about 8 to 10 mins, I then went back and got the tugger that had been leaked on, and took it to the QA area to put it out of order. I then took my QA cart to the Hazmat cage and put the damaged portion of the package into a lined salvage drum. DescribePack: Package failed due to a loose cap on one of the bottles of Warewashing Detergents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I went to the spill area, and put the chemical neutralizer onto the spilled liquid and then put the shredded absorbing material onto it as well. I put caution tape over the area, and the next morning, I pH tested several spots, as well as the spots on the tugger, and then put down more neutralizer as needed. I then waited until about 11:00a that morning to sweep up the neutralizer and absorbing material into a hazardous material bag, and place it into the salvage drum with the other damaged portion of the damaged package.

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: Houston
  • State: TX

  • Carrier/Reporter: SKYWEST AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 22nd, 2023, SkyWest flight UA4691 was traveling from Oklahoma City to Houston. While on final approach passenger Ronnie Princes Apple MagSafe device went into thermal runaway. The SkyWest flight attendant responded to the fire with the halon fire extinguisher. The flight landed and the fire department responded to the aircraft. Passenger was treated for burn to hands and transported to the hospital via Life Flight. The device is reported to be an Apple MagSafe battery pack, passenger took the device with him and will not talk to SkyWest or United Airlines.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Received call over radio about leaking hazmat at WA357. Put on gloves, took bin and absorbent mats with me, placed wet package in bin, used absorbent mats on leakage that escaped box, placed on cart, took to hazmat cage for inspection and processing DescribePack: Inspection revealed a small hole in the bottom of the bottle. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Put on gloves, quickly placed package in bin, used absorbent mats on leakage that escaped the box, placed on cart, took to hazmat cage for inspection and processing, ran hands under cold water for an extended period of time just in case.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damaged package picked up from the unload. Upon inspection, the damaged products contained an undeclared hazmat. The package was damaged out by another station and returned to sender. A SDS was obtained for the damaged product. The other four containers were not damaged. The damaged product had a loose cap and leakage amounting to 1.057X4 Gallons. The damaged undeclared hazmat was placed in a hazmat bag and red bin. Proper paperwork was filed and that hazmat was brought to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: There was a loose cap and leakage from Detail King Bug Off. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged undeclared hazmat was placed in a hazmat bag and red bin. The hazmat was then placed in the hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon receiving the trailer, we could smell that there was a damage item and upon removing the hazmat we could see that it was in fact damaged. Using proper PPE gear to assess the hazmat we found that the lid to one of the glass bottles of tetrahydrofuran had a loose cap which caused the liquid to leak out. DescribePack: Package failed due to the cap of one of the bottles of tetrahydrofuran being loose and leaking out only causing damage to itself. There are no holes in the box due to the spill. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Quickly removed the damaged hazmat before anymore of the liquid could leak out and cause any damage to other packages.
